results.content: I liked  this R programming course. I gave it 5 stars because it is a well organized  course, properly divided into sections and small lessons, quizzes and homework assignments helped in practicing the topics, the way Kirill explained each topic was easy to understand.
results.content_html: I liked this R programming course. I gave it 5 stars because it is a well organized course, properly divided into sections and small lessons, quizzes and homework assignments helped in practicing the topics, the way Kirill explained each topic was easy to understand.

results.content: I really enjoyed the course. This is coming from someone with no previous experience in R or any coding language. The fist lesson was  a bit overwhelming, but the rest were better and more on par with what I expected. Recommend!
results.content_html: I really enjoyed the course. This is coming from someone with no previous experience in R or any coding language. The fist lesson was a bit overwhelming, but the rest were better and more on par with what I expected. Recommend!

results.content: It is more like R Programming A-U, instead of A-Z. All sections are great, and the examples are good. I just wish that there was more of it. Outside the basics, the course just explores ggplot2. I wish that there was enough practices with various types of graphs on top of follow-along type of tutorials.
results.content_html: It is more like R Programming A-U, instead of A-Z. All sections are great, and the examples are good. I just wish that there was more of it. Outside the basics, the course just explores ggplot2. I wish that there was enough practices with various types of graphs on top of follow-along type of tutorials.

results.content: Honestly, the order in which everything was taught was nice. It really helped you develop gradually but perfectly. I look forward to taking the next course when it’s on sale!
results.content_html: Honestly, the order in which everything was taught was nice. It really helped you develop gradually but perfectly. I look forward to taking the next course when it’s on sale!

results.content: Great material to learn R from. Always a happy, involved teacher, questions answered pretty quickly, lots of Q&As to learn from others, lessons covered a great deal of commands, several ways to apply, and great real life situations to apply code to. Very glad I took this, and will follow it up with offers they gave to learn more.
results.content_html: Great material to learn R from. Always a happy, involved teacher, questions answered pretty quickly, lots of Q&As to learn from others, lessons covered a great deal of commands, several ways to apply, and great real life situations to apply code to. Very glad I took this, and will follow it up with offers they gave to learn more.

results.content: Thank you, Kirill. I was weak in programming but now I am confident that I learnt the basics of an entirely new language
results.content_html: Thank you, Kirill. I was weak in programming but now I am confident that I learnt the basics of an entirely new language

results.content: Great course! Pacing very good - not too fast, not too slow. Nice data sets and example problems, well suited to the subject matter of the given section.
results.content_html: Great course! Pacing very good - not too fast, not too slow. Nice data sets and example problems, well suited to the subject matter of the given section.

results.content: This was a great course on the basics of R programming. I enjoyed the visualization and analysis of different types of data. I had fun solving the exercises too.
results.content_html: This was a great course on the basics of R programming. I enjoyed the visualization and analysis of different types of data. I had fun solving the exercises too.

results.content: This course is exactly what I needed. It has all the fundamental concepts of R covered in a systematic and step-by-step manner. The course challenges were very interesting and fun to solve. Most important of all, the instructor - Kirill was fabulous as always. I have completed his Tableau course as well and I would recommend everyone to take the courses provided by him as they really help a lot. Thanks a lot, Kirill and the entire Ligency Team! Cheers!
results.content_html: This course is exactly what I needed. It has all the fundamental concepts of R covered in a systematic and step-by-step manner. The course challenges were very interesting and fun to solve. Most important of all, the instructor - Kirill was fabulous as always. I have completed his Tableau course as well and I would recommend everyone to take the courses provided by him as they really help a lot. Thanks a lot, Kirill and the entire Ligency Team! Cheers!

results.content:
I am a statistics graduate student and when I started this course I had zero knowledge about R and coding in general. Throughout my first semester, I really struggled with coding and I'm one of those people who just thought I would never really get it no matter what I tried. However, that all changed over the course of the school year as I learned R on my own and with the help of this course. By the time I was done with my second semester I actually felt pretty competent in R. Not to the point where I can just look at a problem and instantly know how to code it (like some R wizards can do), but to the point where I actually feel comfortable explaining how to do lots of things in R to other people who are just starting and being able to figure out moderately complex problems on my own or with minimal google searching for function syntax.  

This course was an absolutely critical component of my learning experience. It made me realize that you don't need to memorize everything about R, you just need to understand what tools R gives you and then frame your problem in those terms. Kirill is an excellent teacher and he really gets to the meat of each skill and technique he is trying to show you in each lesson. He doesn't gloss over things, he explains them in basic terms and builds from there. He seems to have a good intuition for what you're thinking as he explains things, too. There were many times where I would be following his lesson and ask myself a question only to have him bring it up a moment later and explain it fully. 

If you do buy his course, I would advise you to do the lessons in chunks and make sure you really get what was taught before moving on to the next ones. Most importantly, go back and reference lessons when needed. I did this countless times and it really helped to reinforce my learning. If I was stuck on a particular part of a problem in real life I would think "wait, I saw something like this in the tutorials" and then I would go back and watch that lesson. Every time I did this it helped me to better understand the reasoning behind it instead of just quickly googling an answer that I only half understand.

So, in summary, this course helped me out tremendously as both a straight up tutorial with applicable content and also as a valuable reference that I could always go back to when needed to ensure I understood why certain functions or methods worked the way they do. I highly recommend this course!

results.content: It was amazing, teacher show how to steep the learning curve. There were so good explanations about how R is based and that let to face with better understanding the different tools despite sometimes the sound was lower to listen some commentaries.
